segment.source: About the Virtual Registry Tab
segment.target: About the Virtual Registry Tab

segment.source: About the Virtual Registry Tab
segment.target: About the Virtual Registry Tab

segment.source: About the Virtual Registry Tab
segment.target: About the Virtual Registry Tab

segment.source: A virtual registry is created during sequencing.
segment.target: A virtual registry is created during sequencing.

segment.source: The Virtual Registry tab displays all the registry keys and values that are required for a sequenced application package to run.
segment.target: The Virtual Registry tab displays all the registry keys and values that are required for a sequenced application package to run.

segment.source: Use this tab to add, edit, and delete registry keys and registry values.
segment.target: Use this tab to add, edit, and delete registry keys and registry values.

segment.source: You can also choose to ignore the hosting system’s keys by selecting Override Local Key, or you can create a merged view of the key from within the virtual environment by selecting Merge with Local Key.
segment.target: You can also choose to ignore the hosting system’s keys by selecting Override Local Key, or you can create a merged view of the key from within the virtual environment by selecting Merge with Local Key.

segment.source: The changes to the virtual registry Settings tab affect applications that are part of the specific sequenced application package, but they do not affect the operation of other applications that are streamed to or locally installed on the Application Virtualization Desktop Client.
segment.target: The changes to the virtual registry Settings tab affect applications that are part of the specific sequenced application package, but they do not affect the operation of other applications that are streamed to or locally installed on the Application Virtualization Desktop Client.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Exercise caution when changing virtual registry keys and values.
segment.target: Exercise caution when changing virtual registry keys and values.

segment.source: Changing these keys and values might render your sequenced application package inoperable.
segment.target: Changing these keys and values might render your sequenced application package inoperable.

segment.source: The left pane of the Virtual Registry tab displays the full list of virtual registries created during the sequencing of an application.
segment.target: The left pane of the Virtual Registry tab displays the full list of virtual registries created during the sequencing of an application.

segment.source: Columns
segment.target: Columns

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: The name for the entry in the virtual registry.
segment.target: The name for the entry in the virtual registry.

segment.target: Type

segment.source: How the entry stores its data.
segment.target: How the entry stores its data.

segment.source: Data
segment.target: Data

segment.source: The value stored by the entry.
segment.target: The value stored by the entry.

segment.source: Attributes
segment.target: Attributes

segment.source: Displays the file attributes.
segment.target: Displays the file attributes.
